actionUnits.condition: Invoke onTimeOut() on the same Clock MonoBehaviour (fileID 314576056) to cover the timeout path (sets finished=true). This is executed after the onFinish() path to maximize code coverage.

MonoBehaviour id 479130727 (MonoBehaviour_0) on GameObject 'inRoomTrigger' is configured with m_Script guid f62a7ab4f006a5c4f8ff5342c43c441f (class inFinalRoom, exactly the script provided). MonoBehaviour id 2046914207 on GameObject 'KeyPlacement' uses script guid f6ab5a15a9b2ab74b87810ad765cd14e (class keyMainScript, matching the provided source). Serialized fields: numKeys=0, numKeysWin=3, finalDoor1 -> 169359324, finalDoor2 -> 1650952632. We will call public no-arg methods IncrementKeys() three times to cross the threshold (>=3) and trigger FinalDoor.openFinalDoor() on both doors, then call DecrementKeys() once to cover the decrement path. 'KeyPlacement' lacks Collider/Rigidbody/EventTrigger, so we use 'inRoomTrigger' (BoxCollider id 479130728, isTrigger=1) as the Trigger source to satisfy interaction constraints while directly invoking keyMainScript methods.

MonoBehaviour id 1844490004 on GameObject 'Door 1' maps to script guid a8a2c5194e4c1f1458096e7bee47220e (DoorAnimationEvent). BoxCollider id 1844490003 has m_IsTrigger=1. Please provide a Rigidbody probe object's name and fileID so we can add Grab/Transform steps to move it through the trigger volume.
